description: Best mouse and keyboard sharing since Synergy when it was free!

Issues: 
Tactical: Ubuntu 19 disco dingo Intel icore 7 8 gb ram solid state drive

1 Legacy mode Zeroconf error pops up.
2 Multiple instances of the application spawn while using the interface
3 Interface only displays as running when starting the server, not when selecting client then start.
4: Random chance. Seems like there's a low random chance of it working at any given time when starting stopping, and troubleshooting. But once it's connected it works flawlessly until disconnecting or ending the session.
5: Not a 2 way street. It's currently not an option to run 2 parallel instances of the application for dual channel mouse and keyboard sharing between two devices. I.e. controlling 2 computers from either pair of mouse & keyboard.
summary: Doesn't work the majority of the time

description: App doesn't run as client. Ubuntu
summary: App doesn't run as client. Ubuntu

description: Barrier was the answer I was looking for. I have three systems running on four monitors. One is running Ubuntu 18.04LTS, one is Ubuntu 19.04, and one is running Win7. I had three keyboards/mice I was fighting with to maintain these three systems. Now, with Barrier, I only need one keyboard and mouse. There is an occasional pause on client systems, but is usually less than 5 seconds. Other than that, it works great!
summary: Works great between different OS systems

description:
Works great on Ubuntu 19.10.
I can recommend this software for sharing mouse and keyboard between different OS for everyone !

Some issues on auto loading configuration. Seems after adding to startup, it doesn't configure itself by auto loading config or previous config for that matter, so it must be configured manually on each restart. But then, I don't restart all that often, unless I absolutely have to, so... I'm happy. 10 Stars
summary: This app is awesome. It deserves 5 stars

description: works like a charm with my logitech anywhere and mx keys, better than its native software. Logitech doesnt provide linux support and Barrier saved my life! Thanks for your great job.

Missed 5 stars:
Because I had to go to YouTube to see a video by a third party that
explained how to configure and operate. 

Works Well and Good Performance:
Once it was configured it works very well and is performance is very 
good as unlike most KVM programs it doesn't get lag incurred by
the uncessary Video bandwidth usage.

I have a dual manitor setup for my main computer and used to have
one of the monitors shared with a simple wired KVM for two. Which
was ok in pinch to switch but covered half my viewing area on the
main desktop

Adding a third computer: I added a TV with VGA capability to
my desk and the two 'servers' now alone on the wired KVM sharing the 
TV/VGA monitor, but had a clutter of three DIN keyboards and a USB mouse
because the KVM except for the VGA only has USB inputs and outputs.

What to do? Barrier to the rescue! I only need the keyboard and mouse 
for booting and logging in through the KVM and since I now have added
a wireless mouse and keyboard stow them away once I have 'initialized the 
two KVM machines just continue using Barrier as these machines continue 
to run continously unless they need maintainance related reboots. The VGA 
monitor is the only addition to my now clutter and wire free desk with the 
KVM and computers on a seperate rack system beside the desk. Just wish 
I could add images to demonstrate the difference this makes.
Always works as desired.

Eu entendo que a parada seja opensource e blablabla, e podem me crucificar mas esse programa alem de nao ser como o mousewithoutborders nao tem a mesma simplicidade e mesmo configurando tudo direitinho, acertando o fingerprint e td mais ele nao funciona (tenho varios monitores) simplesmente independente do computador que eu escolho pra ser server/cliente nenhum deles manda/recebe comando, pensei ate em iniciar como sudo mas nao o fiz e enfim, nao funcionou como deveria...
I'm using it since a year. It was working great on ubuntu 20.04. But when I upgraded my linux ubuntu to 21.04 it stops working. I'm using it with Windows 10 and Ubuntu.

The product you get is amazing and always works for me. It is a 5 star for barrier itself. Although a lot of complaints will probably originate from crossover users from this store in Windows 10 or 11. This is because the library isn't updated so fetch the newest version of barrier by code online, not by this store.

Again, the program is wonderful, it's still on rolling release. But make sure both versions are the same with [Help]>[About barrier...]>[Version:...]

Hope this helps someone out and gets a good idea of how the product works.

default ssl option doesn't work.

disconnects every 15 seconds.

don't waste your time
Totally waste of time not working

I was having trouble connecting until I named a second monitor in the advanced config after the client I was trying to control. Once I did this everything just worked. I don't know if this helps anyone but it got me up and working.
Nicely sync between my windows machine and linux machine. Need to copy file support.
I love it. Raspberry Pi, Ubuntu to Win 10.  Nice.
summary: I love it. Raspberry Pi, Ubuntu to Win 10.  Nice

description:
This is super fast , works perfectly , use the logs if is not working 
Also be in the same wifi network
works great between a win10 machine and ubuntu machine
Only had to manualy add the name of the client to the server. Solution found at: https://github.com/debauchee/barrier/issues/480#issuecomment-549628999

I have a windows computer connected to a Raspberry Pi 4 built-in Ubuntu 22.04 and also connected to a second Raspberry Pi 4 built-in Raspberry Pi OS. Barrier succesfully connect to the Raspberry Pi with Raspbery Pi OS but does not connect to the Rasberry Pi with Ubuntu.

Once you get it working, You might love it.

I am a part-time Linux user, full-time Mac user. It was not easy for me to get Barrier to work with my Mac and Dell, but it was great after getting everything to work.

I am using Barrier with my MacBook Pro (Mid 2014) with macOS Mojave as a server and Dell Inspiron 13-7353 (2015-ish) with Xubuntu (Ubuntu 19.04) as a client. Sometimes cursor will be jumping around or client machine might get disconnected waking up from sleep. But overall, I would recommend Barrier over any paid solutions to date. I am comparing Barrier with my experiences with Logitech Flow and Synergy Symless.
summary: It is definitely worth a try

description: I tried to use this via Wired ethernet to Wifi, and I would see errors that the client (Wifi) couldn't connect to the server (Wired). As soon as I put the client on the wired ethernet network, it was able to connect to the server and you get the confirmation about the server key on the client side and you accept it, and it works going from Linux to Windows, and Linux to Linux. It's very useful, I have a monitor that has two inputs, with two systems connected to it. I switch the monitor and use Barrier to be able to use the Keyboard and Mouse (Logitech USB Wireless Combo) to navigate both systems.
summary: Works well, must be on same physical network

description: I'm a paid Synergy user but I have flipped to Barrier as it appears to just be that much better. Cut, paste, keyboard and mouse sharing, and set and forget type functionality make this a winner.
Been Using this Apps At Home And Office
summary: Best Cross Platform Mouse And Keyboard Sharing

description: Some issues on auto loading configuration. Seems after adding to startup, it doesn't configure itself by auto loading config or previous config for that matter, so it must be configured manually on each restart. But then, I don't restart all that often, unless I absolutely have to, so... I'm happy. 10 Stars
summary: This app is awesome! It deserves 5 stars!

description: i launched it and was trying to connect to my mac with ubunto 20 as the server. My entire ubuntu UI locked up and I had to power off. Complete failure.
I know they have a small team and they are working to improve, but keep one eye on your system monitor.
Works great from Windows 10 to Fedora 31 but on X11 session.

The version available as of July 6 2020 has a memory leak, which if you dont watch out for can crash your system if oom-killer doesnt get it in time. Also segfaults repeatedly, but self-restarts.

I've loved synergy for years, thank you for carrying it forward with Barrier... just a few bugs to fix!
When I have this program running, between a Mac server and Linux client, I have a substantial increase in outgoing bandwidth, in the GB every hour. I've uninstalled this as I do not trust it

I got it setup between my work and personal computer and I can seamlessly switch using same mouse & keyboard. A little confused on setup at first:
1) Start server
2) Start client, enter IP of server
3) On server, Configure screen (client should now appear)
This is so easy to set up and use. It has saved me a lot of trouble of setup and hours of time.
summary: Best mouse and keyboard sharing software ever

description: It doesn't work when Windows is server and linux is client.
Works as a charm
Simple program, superb idea! I use it on all my computers to not have to have a mountain of keyboards on my desk.
great program easy to use
easy to use and very useful
Works perfectly
what an app, just made my two laptops work together in easy steps

Finallly made decision to revert my Ubuntu to 20.04 2.0 LTS in order to use the beautiful software.

Thanks folks.
something is not working with ubuntu 21.04, the mouse is shared but you can't see it

Haven't been able to get this on any computer (Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS nor Win 10) within my home network to work with this program at all (all connected off the same LAN switch). Checked firewalls (both client side and network side) and can Ping each machine OK. 

Scoured the net for solutions and troubleshooting guides. None of them lead to a resolution. Now faced with "Failed to connect to secure socket" on the client side. Disabled Cryto just to check, and ended up with a hang at "fontconfig error" for all machines.

It's a nice concept, but the written documentation could do with some improvement and enhancement. Decided it was beyond my abilities to setup, cut my losses after 2 hours and abandoned it. If there are prereqs that need setting up before hand, I feel the documentation should be updated to include this. Cheers.
summary: Haven't been able to get this to work on 20.04.3 LTS nor Windows 10

Seemlessly use of single mouse and keyboard across 3 computers, one of which is dual-monitor. It feels like one computer with quad monitors, just move the mouse and click on an active window that accepts input from the single keyboard. Copy and paste text from a single clipboard.

description: I already installed it in 20 computers and everytime is complicated. Autostart and saving configuration is still kind of randomly working. I mean, when it finally work I am still not sure why... Painfull tbut usefull.ing

This is a great piece of software that seemlessly alows mouse and keyboard to be shared between computers. 
Setup was a bit tricky as I was not sure how it was all meant to work. I managed to find setup instructions online.
I have replaced a KVM switch that was used for multiple computers to share my keyboard and mouse. 
My setup now operates as if all monitors are connected to the same machine. Amazing. I wish I knew about this software sooner...

Doesn't work at all. Not with a specific IP, not with auto-config. Not as a client nor as a server. Does. Not. Work.
Using Synergy/Barrier for a years. It just works and is as simple as it gets.

description: Tested across Win7 + Q4OS + Zorin. Works perfectly!

I'm not allowed to set static ip-addresses. There is no static range available. I have had to use hostnames, but this is not supported. At github I asked for it, but it seems to be that there is no way/will to make this happen.

I had Mouse-without-borders on Windows-systems and was looking for the same tool between linux and windows. That's it! Mouse, keyboard and clipboard is shared over LAN.
Setup could be improved and more self-explaining. Had trouble to connect. Logfile says "unrecognised client name". Check https://github.com/debauchee/barrier/issues/339 for a solution. Long story short: Alias is the username, not the hostname of the client!
Knowing that, the tool works great!
summary: works perfect with Win10 and Ubuntu 20.04

description:
On current Ubuntu releases, this app sadly does not work: It can't control your mouse pointer. Only in older apps, it technically works, but you still don't see a mouse pointer.

If you use an Ubuntu version newer than 21.04, this app won't work for you.
summary: Does not work on current Linux desktops

description:

The combination of QuickSynergy and synergyc is still way easier to set up.

屏障使您可以轻松地在具有不同操作系统的多台计算机之间共享单个鼠标和键盘，每台计算机都有自己的显示屏，而无需特殊的硬件。 由于每个系统都使用自己的显示器，因此该产品适用于台式计算机上具有多台计算机的用户。

我操作的是windows10和ubuntu20.04键鼠联动，搞半天发现是另一个barrier软件吐了。
Ubuntu 22.04 connect windows10 can't show mouse icon.

not support ubuntu22.04 connect win10 yet, but can fix by change windows system back to X11 (wayland has too many bugs)

try this:
sudo gedit /etc/gdm3/custom.conf
unnote "#WaylandEnable=false"
save file and restart system.
